sub_title: General Manager Central & Eastern Europe at Costa Coffee
summary:
I am a Foody, Business Leader and Marketing professional with over 20 years experience in all aspects of marketing management and over 10 years experience as a company board member.

I have always worked in international roles: I really like the Challenge of learning a new culture, a new language, new Business models. I am now back in the UK again, I was in Poland from 2018 to 2021, before that I lived and worked for 6 years in Germany with a business responsibility for Austria and Switzerland, I also lived and worked in Russia and I have done projects in Ukraine, Belarus, the US, France, Spain, Portugal, Italy, Scandinavia and Greece.

I am at my best when I can bring structure and new Elan in Businesses. I thrive when I can develop a team to rise above themselves, implementing better processes and creating best practices. 

Key Capabilities:
- Fluent in English, German and Dutch. Basic knowledge of Japanese and French
- Culturally sensitive and easily able to adapt to new cultures
- Experienced project manager
- Leading & developing multi-cultural teams
- Developing and executing Category & Brand Strategy
- Developing consumer, shopper & customer insights
- Concept creation
- Brand portfolio management
- Digital Activation, CRM and E-commerce
- Consumer & Shopper Activation campaigns
- Reorganization & Change Management
- New process development
- FMCG, Savoury snacks, Agriculture, Household appliances, Dairy, Seasonings, Tea, Coffee.
- The Netherlands, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Russia, UK, Ukraine, Belarus, USA, France, Spain, Portugal, Italy, Scandinavia, Greece, Poland, Baltics, CEE

profile_positions.description: After many years of being the most loved coffeeshop in the UK, Costa is now further expanding in Central and East Europe via at home and away from home channels. We do this in partnership with Coca Cola Hellenics and I am lucky enough to lead this from the Costa Side.
profile_positions.title: General Manager Central & East Europe

profile_positions.description: After 4 years B2B responsibility I switched back to B2C and was given the opportunity to move to a new country and assume full business responsibility next to my marketing role: leading both the marketing teams on Foods (Knorr, Hellmann’s, Tortex, Amino) and Tea (Lipton, Saga, Pukka) as well the cross functional business teams (‘CCBT’) with P&L responsibility for the Foods & Tea business in Poland and the Baltics, member of the local Leadership team, based in Warsaw.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Director & Business Leader Foods and Tea Poland & Baltics

profile_positions.description:
in 2014 UFS went through a Reorganisation and as a result I became the Marketing leader for UFS DACH. In this role I was responsible for Brand Building of the Unilever Food Solutions Portfolio in Germany, Austria and Switzerland. In these markets UFS is Market leader with a portfolio of strong global and local brands such as Knorr, Hellmann's, Lipton, Lukull, Pfanni, Rama and Becel.  Responsible for the deployment of  category strategy, brand plans and Innovation across 9 product categories with a team of 30 marketers based in Germany, Austria and Switzerland, I am a Member of the DACH Management Team.

Apart from 'classical' Marketing responsibilities, my role includes leading the Digital & E-com Team and creating the right environment and tools to Change UFS DACH in a more agile and digital Organisation.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Director DACH

profile_positions.description:
During my time in Heilbronn, I learned about Unilever Food Solutions, which is also based in Heilbronn. UFS is the largest Convenience Supplier in Food Service with an ambitious Vision to shape and grow the market. DACH is the 3rd biggest Market for UFS (After China and North America). 

In this role I was responsible for Channel marketing strategy Development & Deployment of a.o. the Knorr, Lukull, Lipton, Carte d'Or, Mondamin, Pfanni Portfolio of Savoury, Dressings and Desserts in Germany, Austria and Switzerland. Member of the DACH Management Team, leading a team of 15 channel marketeers based in the different DACH countries.
profile_positions.title: Channel Marketing Director DACH

profile_positions.description:
During my work as Global Shopper Marketing Manager in Germany I was asked to take over the local Marketing Director role for Germany and Austria. After the Netherlands, Germany is the biggest Market for FrieslandCampina. 

In this role I was Consumer & Shopper Marketing Responsible for the FrieslandCampina branded and PL retail portfolio in Germany and Austria, member of the Management team, leading a team of 13, based in Germany. 

We were a completely new Management team with a special assignment to reorganize the German OpCo and bring it back to profitability.  Achievements: 
- Reorganisation of the Marketing department to optimize the alignment with Sales, Supply Chain and Plan & Deliver; including the foundation of a shopper marketing department, realignment of processes, reduction of FTE’s, complexity reduction programs, integration of Cheese and Butter operating units (‘one face to the customer’) from Essen and Cologne in the Heilbronn office. 
- Development of a new long term strategy for the OpCo Germany including Brand (a.o. Landliebe, Optiwell) and Brand portfolio strategy. 
- Implementation of the local category strategy.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Director Germany & Austria

profile_positions.description:
Upon my return from the UK, I became member of a new global team, responsible for the development of the Global Shopper Marketing Strategy and implementation within the FrieslandCampina Operating Companies (OpCo’s). 
This involves:
- Coach OpCo’s in the development of local category strategies, based on consumer, shopper, customer and channel insights leading to compelling selling stories and laying the foundation for joint business planning. 
- Ensuring the effectiveness of Shopper research by setting Global guidelines, provide help on briefings & agency selection and the exchange of best practices. 
- Development & implementation of a globally aligned, category based, integrated business planning process, leading to more effective commercial plans
 Development & global implementation of a set of pricing and promotion tools, leading to a more efficient use of resources and higher effectiveness.

One of my Key Countries was Germany.
profile_positions.title: Global Shopper Marketing Manager

profile_positions.description:
When my previous role at Campina ceased to exist, I was promoted to Marketing Director for FrieslandCampina in the UK. In this role I was located in the UK and responsible for all marketing activities of FrieslandCampina's operating company in the UK, leading a team of 8 marketeers & product developers, member of the local management team. 

Half our Business was in branded Products, such as the local Brand YAZOO, the other half in DoB. This enabled me to be customer facing. During this period, we managed to gain several new DoB contracts as well as substantially grwo the YAZOO braded Business.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Director UK & Ireland

profile_positions.description:
FrieslandCampina is the third largest Dairy Company in the world. They are a cooperation owned by Dutch and German Farmers. I joined them because my Father is actually one of these farmers and I have milk running through my veins.  I also wanted to develop myself further in Brand Building and have a broader decision scope than I had at Philips. 

In this role I had the responsibility for all marketing activities of the Campina Cream division, leading a team of 3, member of the local management team. A key achievement during this time was the Launch of a new, fresh culinary cooking range sourced at co-packers, which at the time was a relatively new Business model at Campina. In 2008 it was announced that Campina would merge with Friesland Foods and Consumer Cream Business Unit would cease to exist.
profile_positions.title: Sr Product Group Manager Consumer Cream Products

profile_positions.description: Upon my return from Russia, I accepted the role of regional coordinator of all marketing activities for Sonicare and Sensiflex electric toothbrushes in the EMEA region. In this capability I was the linking pin between the Brand Development Unit in the USA and the local sales and Marketing Units in EMEA.  Key assignment of this role was to make sure forecast and stakeholders were aligned.
profile_positions.title: Sr Marketing Manager Sonicare EMEA region

profile_positions.description: As Brand Development Manager for Food Processors my Lead Market was Russia. When the local Marketing Manager of all Kitchen appliances went on Maternity Leave, I fulfilled this role ad interim, located in Moscow. It gave me the opportunity to Launch the appliances I developed in the years before. During my appointment in Russia, we were able to grow the Foods Business with 20%+.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Manager Kitchen Appliances a.i.

profile_positions.description:
Philips Domestic Appliances and Personal Care is the Business line responsible for domestic appliances within Philips. I joined their Food Business in 2003 because I wanted to further develop my Brand Development skills. 

In this role I was responsible for Brand Development ( insight generation, concept creation, new product development and portfolio Management) of the food processor category within the Philips DAP FOOD Business unit. Focus Markets were Central and Eastern Europe. We managed to grow Market share in this category in this Region over this period of time with an avarage of 10% Points.
profile_positions.title: Sr Productmanager Food (Brand Development Manager Food Processors)

profile_positions.description:
FarmFrites was the world's 4th supplier of Frozen Fries and Potato specialities at the time. Their Headoffice is based in the Netherlands and they have local sales Offices and planst around the world. 

I Joined FarmFrites because I wanted to work Internationally and more agile. 

In  this role I was responsible for the Portfolio Management of the Food Service Portfolio in Europe. This included NPD, Portfolio optimization as well as supporting (Presenting, Organizing Tastepanels, relationship Management with key Partners at large Clients)  Key Account Managers locally in presenting, tendering and listing the Portfolio.
profile_positions.title: Productmanager Food Service

profile_positions.description: Sara Lee Douwe Egberts was at the time the owner of the local Dutch Brand Duyvis, market leader in coated Peanuts (part of the savoury Snack category). I started here as Junior Productmanager in B2C, doing NPD, Packaging development, production of MarCom materials.
profile_positions.title: jr. Productmanager Savoury Snacks
